kodkod.engine.satlab

Class SATFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • kodkod.engine.satlab.SATFactory

  • public abstract class SATFactory
extends Object
    A factory for generating SATSolver instances of a given type. Built-in support is provided for many solvers, including SAT4J and the MiniSat solver by Niklas Eén and Niklas Sörensson.
    Author:
    Emina Torlak

        The factory that produces instances of the default sat4j solver.
        See Also:

      • Glucose

        public static final SATFactory Glucose
        The factory that produces instances of Gilles Audemard and Laurent Simon's Glucose solver.

      • LightSAT4J

        public static final SATFactory LightSAT4J
        The factory that produces instances of the "light" sat4j solver. The light solver is suitable for solving many small instances of SAT problems.
        See Also:
        ASolverFactory.lightSolver()

      • Lingeling

        public static final SATFactory Lingeling
        The factory that produces instances of Armin Biere's Lingeling solver.

      • MiniSat

        public static final SATFactory MiniSat
        The factory that produces instances of Niklas Eén and Niklas Sörensson's MiniSat solver.

      • MiniSatProver

        public static final SATFactory MiniSatProver
        The factory the produces proof logging instances of the MiniSat solver. Note that core extraction can incur a significant time overhead during solving, so if you do not need this functionality, use the MiniSat factory instead.

    • Method Detail

      • available

        Returns true iff the given factory generates solvers that are available for use on this system.
        Returns:
        true iff the given factory generates solvers that are available for use on this system.

      • externalFactory

        public static final SATFactory externalFactory(String executable,
                                               String cnf,
                                               String... options)
        Returns a SATFactory that produces SATSolver wrappers for the external SAT solver specified by the executable parameter. The solver's input and output formats must conform to the SAT competition standards. The solver will be called with the specified options, and it is expected to write properly formatted output to standard out. If the cnf string is non-null, it will be used as the file name for generated CNF files by all solver instances that the factory generates. If cnf null, each solver instance will use an automatically generated temporary file, which will be deleted when the solver instance is garbage-collected. The cnf file, if provided, is not automatically deleted; it is the caller's responsibility to delete it when no longer needed. External solvers are never incremental.
        Returns:
        SATFactory that produces SATSolver wrappers for the specified external SAT solver

      • incremental

        public boolean incremental()
        Returns true if the solvers returned by this.instance() are incremental; i.e. if clauses/variables can be added to the solver between multiple calls to solve().
        Returns:
        true if the solvers returned by this.instance() are incremental

      • instance

        public abstract SATSolver instance()
        Returns an instance of a SATSolver produced by this factory.
        Returns:
        a SATSolver instance

      • plingeling

        public static final SATFactory plingeling()
        Returns a SATFactory that produces SATSolver wrappers for Armin Biere's Plingeling solver. This is a parallel solver that is invoked as an external program rather than via the Java Native Interface. As a result, it cannot be used incrementally. Its external factory manages the creation and deletion of temporary files automatically. A statically compiled version of plingeling is assumed to be available in a java.library.path directory. The effect of this method is the same as calling plingeling(null, null).
        Returns:
        SATFactory that produces SATSolver wrappers for the Plingeling solver

      • plingeling

        public static final SATFactory plingeling(Integer threads,
                                          Boolean portfolio)
        Returns a SATFactory that produces SATSolver wrappers for Armin Biere's Plingeling solver. This is a parallel solver that is invoked as an external program rather than via the Java Native Interface. As a result, it cannot be used incrementally. Its external factory manages the creation and deletion of temporary files automatically. A statically compiled version of plingeling is assumed to be available in a java.library.path directory.

        Plingling takes as input two optional parameters: threads, specifying how many worker threads to use, and portfolio, specifying whether the threads should run in portfolio mode (no sharing of clauses) or sharing mode. If threads is null, the solver uses one worker per core. If portfolio is null, it is set to true by default.

        Requires:
        threads != null => numberOfThreads > 0
        Returns:
        SATFactory that produces SATSolver wrappers for the Plingeling solver

      • prover

        public boolean prover()
        Returns true if the solvers returned by this.instance() are SATProvers. Otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the solvers returned by this.instance() are SATProvers. Otherwise returns false.

      • sat4jFactory

        public static final SATFactory sat4jFactory(String solverName)
        Returns a SATFactory that produces instances of the specified SAT4J solver. For the list of available SAT4J solvers see org.sat4j.core.ASolverFactory#solverNames().
        Requires:
        solverName is a valid solver name
        Returns:
        a SATFactory that returns the instances of the specified SAT4J solver
        See Also:
        ASolverFactory.solverNames()
